subject: Cybersecurity
title: Computer Crime Classifications: What Makes a Hack Illegal?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Computer Crime Classifications: What Makes a Hack Illegal?.

hook.text: Is it illegal to guess someone's password? What about finding an open door to a system and just looking around?

buildup.text: Computer crimes range from unauthorized access and data theft to denial of service and malware distribution, each.

discovery.text: Many laws distinguish between access crimes (entering a system) and damage crimes (destroying or stealing data).

twist.text: Weev (Andrew Auernheimer) went to prison for changing a URL to access public AT&T customer data. The data.

climax.text: The line between 'unauthorized access' and 'following a public link' remains legally unclear. Security researchers.

punchline.text: He changed a number in a URL. He went to prison for hacking.

quiz.question: Why is 'unauthorized access' legally controversial?
options: It's not considered a crime anywhere
The boundary between unauthorized access and accessing publicly available data is often unclear
It only applies to government systems
